conclusion: The horizontal axis is t² (in s²) and the vertical axis is x (in m).
The plotted straight-line segment joins the points (t² = 0 s², x = 6 m) and (t² = 2 s², x = 0 m).

premise: The plotted straight-line segment joins the points (t² = 0 s², x = 6 m) and (t² = 2 s², x = 0 m).
conclusion: Slope m = (0 m – 6 m)/(2 s² – 0 s²) = –3 m / s².
The linear equation is x = 6 – 3 t².
Relate x to t, velocity v and acceleration a.

premise: The linear equation is x = 6 – 3 t².

conclusion: a(t) = dv/dt = d(–6 t)/dt = –6 m s⁻² (constant).
